intro: Bartlettina matudae, commonly known as the Matudae's bartlettina, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and its role in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
